original: Bråkenhielm, Per Gustaf Wilhelm, godsägare, Wallby säteri, Skirö, f. 26/ 10/01 i Göteborg av kapten Reinhold B. o. Marianne Lammers. G. 30 m. frih:an Birgitta Hermelin. Barn: Ulla f. 31, Lena 34, Stina 35, Peder 37, Sven 38, Katarina 42, Birgitta 43. — Realex. i Gbg 18. Utr. res. 18-19, hand:inst. 20-21. Aff:anst. 21-25, jordbr :prakt. 25-27, lantbr:sk. 27-29, insp. 29-35, förv. 35-36, godsäg. 36, fideikommiss. å Wallby 41. Riksantikv. omb. Led. av komm:fullm. i Skirö m. m. Hobbies: ortshist., kyrkore-staur., bibi:- o. arkivstud.
translated: Bråkenhielm, Per Gustaf Wilhelm, estate owner of Wallby Manor in Skirö, born on October 26th, 1901 in Gothenburg to Captain Reinhold B. and Marianne Lammers. Married in 1930 to Baroness Birgitta Hermelin. They had seven children: Ulla (born in 1931), Lena (1934), Stina (1935), Peder (1937), Sven (1938), Katarina (1942), and Birgitta (1943). Per studied in a secondary school in Gothenburg and went abroad from 1918-1919. He attended a commercial institute from 1920-1921 and worked for a company from 1921-1925. From 1925-1927, he worked in agriculture and took a course in farming from 1927-1929. He was an inspector from 1929-1935, then an administrator from 1935-1936, before becoming an estate owner in 1936 and a trustee of the fideicommissum at Wallby in 1941. He was also a representative of the National Antiquities Board. Per had an interest in local history, church restoration, and studies of the Bible and archives.

structured.name: Per Gustaf Wilhelm Bråkenhielm
structured.description: Per Gustaf Wilhelm Bråkenhielm was an estate owner of Wallby Manor in Skirö. He was interested in local history, church restoration, and studies of the Bible and archives.
